definition: troublesome/to take a lot of trouble to do sth
surname Fei
to cost/to spend/fee/wasteful/expenses
matter/thing/item/work/affair/CL:件[jian4],樁|桩[zhuang1],回[hui2]
not troublesome

sentences.english: I wonder why Tatai bothered to set such a feast for me?
sentences.chinese: 奇怪，塔塔伊爲什麼要費事給我擺宴席？

sentences.english: That's not bad for a signing, but it's a lot of work.
sentences.chinese: 對於簽名售書來說，這已經不錯了，但很費事。

sentences.english: No one has bothered to ban a book in decades.
sentences.chinese: 也沒人會費事把一本書禁個幾十年。

sentences.english: Nine bead application of my vexatious rights to provoke nan peja trouble.
sentences.chinese: 九珠應用本人的無理取鬧權益惹楠佩費事。

sentences.english: Courtesy costs little and means much.
sentences.chinese: 禮貌不費事，意義卻很大。

sentences.english: Writing a dictionary is a long and difficult business but we're getting there.
sentences.chinese: 編寫詞典是費時費事的工作，但我們一定能成功。

sentences.english: It is really a pain, you know?
sentences.chinese: 做年夜飯是非常費事的，你知道嗎？

sentences.english: It is difficult to chip old paint off the inside of a container.
sentences.chinese: 從容器的內壁剷下舊油漆很費事。

sentences.english: OK, the bed may be too unwieldy or expensive to replace.
sentences.chinese: 好吧，換張牀可能太費事或太貴了。

sentences.english: We concluded that we were getting off lightly.
sentences.chinese: 我們的結論是，我們不會那麼費事。

sentences.english: This demo needs a little work next year.
sentences.chinese: 明年這個演示也會比較費事。

sentences.english: It’s no skin off your nose, and it might save you from getting into a violent confrontation
sentences.chinese: 這一點都不費事，並能使你免除一場暴力對抗。

sentences.english: Don't bother to get dinner for me. I'll be dining out.
sentences.chinese: 不必費事爲我做飯了，我到外面喫去。

sentences.english: This localization step is expensive but also important.
sentences.chinese: 這個地方化步驟雖然費事卻也很重要。

definition: to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
conversation/CL:個|个[ge4],次[ci4]
something to be taken up later in speech or writing
about a year
under/the underside/below
Guangdong pidgin (a mix of Standard Mandarin and Cantonese)
to act in a play/to put on a play
lit. if it's wrong, it's wrong (idiom); to make the best after a mistake/to accept an error and adapt to it/to muddle through
When you enter a village, follow the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do/When in Rome, do as the Romans do
(longstanding) opponent/enemy/inimical/adversary/opponent
correct/normal/to be on good terms with/on the right track/right
to be a real headache/to find sth a real headache/to beat one's brains
to have one's spirits dampened/to feel disappointed
to become visible/to appear/to manifest one's true nature
lit. a deluge of heavenly flowers (idiom)/fig. extravagant embellishments/hype
to spend (money or time)
to be gravely mistaken (idiom)
